Package ohos.agp.components.element

Class FrameAnimationElement

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.agp.components.element.Element
      • ohos.agp.components.element.ElementContainer
        • ohos.agp.components.element.FrameAnimationElement

  • public class FrameAnimationElement
extends ElementContainer
    Creates frame-by-frame animations using element objects.

    Animations defined by the element objects are mainly used as the background of component objects.

    Since:
    1

        Starts an animation.

        Stops an animation.

        public int getNumberOfFrames​()
        Obtains the number of frames in an animation.

        Returns the number of frames in the animation.

      • getFrame

        public Element getFrame​(int index)
        Obtains the frame of a specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the specified index used to obtain the frame.
        Returns:
        Returns the element object containing the frame.

      • getDuration

        public int getDuration​(int index)
        Obtains the duration of a specified frame in an animation.
        Parameters:
        index - Indicates the index of the specified frame.
        Returns:
        Returns the duration of the specified frame.

      • isOneShot

        public boolean isOneShot​()
        Checks whether an animation is played only once.
        Returns:
        Returns True if the animation is played only once; returns False otherwise.

      • setOneShot

        public void setOneShot​(boolean oneShot)
        Sets whether to play an animation only once.
        Parameters:
        oneShot - Indicates whether the animation is played only once. Value true means that the animation is played only once, and false means the opposite.

      • addFrame

        public void addFrame​(Element frame,
                     int duration)
        Adds an element frame to an animation.
        Parameters:
        frame - Indicates the element frame to add.
        duration - Indicates the duration of the element frame, in milliseconds.

      • setElementState

        public void setElementState​(ElementContainer.ElementState state)
        Sets Animation state to the FrameAnimationElement.
        Overrides:
        setElementState in class ElementContainer
        Parameters:
        state - is ElementState, that should be set.

      • setDisposeMode

        public void setDisposeMode​(boolean isDisposeMode)
        Sets dynamic decoding for this frame animation.
        Parameters:
        isDisposeMode - Specifies whether to enable dynamic decoding for this frame animation. The value true means to enable dynamic decoding, and false means the opposite. If you enable dynamic decoding, you must also call setPreDecodeFrames(int) to set the number of frames to be decoded. Enabling dynamic decoding saves random-access memory (RAM) but may consumes more power.
        Since:
        4

      • getDisposeMode

        public boolean getDisposeMode​()
        Checks whether dynamic decoding is enabled for this frame animation.
        Returns:
        Returns true if dynamic decoding is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • setPreDecodeFrames

        public boolean setPreDecodeFrames​(int preDecodeFrames)
        Sets the number of frames to be decoded before this animation is displayed. This method is available only if dynamic decoding is enabled.
        Parameters:
        preDecodeFrames - Indicates the number of frames to set. The value ranges from 1 to 30.
        Returns:
        Returns True if the preDecodeFrames is set properly; returns False otherwise.
        Since:
        4

      • getPreDecodeFrames

        public int getPreDecodeFrames​()
        Obtains the number of frames to be decoded before this animation is displayed. This method is available only if dynamic decoding is enabled.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of frames if obtained; returns -1 if dynamic decoding is disabled.
        Since:
        4
